Header.Name: Letter
Header.Description: Generic metadata elements for letters, using a combination of elements from EMLO template and the Correspondence Metadata Interchange Format (CMIF).

Component.name: Letter
Component.Documentation: A single message from a sender to one or more organizations or people.

Component.name: Identifier
Component.Documentation: A unique identifier of the resource being described or cataloged. Usage note: The identifier is a text string which is assigned to the resource to provide an unambiguous reference within a particular context.

Element.name: identifierLocal
Element.Documentation: This is to register an identifier which is used locally in your own project.

Element.name: string
Element.Documentation: Add the preferred label that this entity has in the external source.

Element.name: uri
Element.Documentation: The complete URI in the external source (e.g., Yuguslav Wars has Wikidata URI: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q242352.

Element.name: sourceUri
Element.Documentation: The name of the external source/knowledge base used to gather the identifier. If it is OpenStreetMaps: Enter the URI from OpenStreetMap API. You can search directly in OpenStreetMaps and paste the URI here. The URI has to have this format, for example: https://www.openstreetmap.org/relation/214885 (note the type in the middle: relation, node, way)

Element.name: name
Element.Documentation: The name of a Source. For Sources: Use a user-friendly name to identify the source. Depending on the Source type, this may contain a combination of it's name, year of creation, creator, et cetera.

Element.name: additionalType
Element.Documentation: Recommendation for vocabularies to use: https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:resource_type. You can use a term from the PiCo thesaurus for Source types: https://terms.personsincontext.org/sourcetypes . (Internal note: this property is equivalent as this one in PiCo: https://schema.org/additionalType).

Element.name: accessURL
Element.Documentation: A URL of the resource that gives access to it. In PiCo: A media object, usually a scan, that encodes the Source of a Person observation (https://schema.org/associatedMedia).

Element.name: landingPage
Element.Documentation: Optional: A Web page that can be navigated to in a Web browser to gain access to the catalog, a dataset, [a source], its distributions and/or additional information (e.g., HTML page with description, metadata, links, DOI landing page, catalog page, Zotero item page)

Element.name: abstract
Element.Documentation: An abstract is a short description that summarizes a CreativeWork.

Component.name: Keywords
Component.Documentation: Add as many keywords as wanted, making sure they have URIs.

Element.name: string
Element.Documentation: Add the preferred label that this entity has in the external source.

Element.name: uri
Element.Documentation: The complete URI in the external source (e.g., Yuguslav Wars has Wikidata URI: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q242352.

Element.name: sourceUri
Element.Documentation: The name of the external source/knowledge base used to gather the identifier. If it is OpenStreetMaps: Enter the URI from OpenStreetMap API. You can search directly in OpenStreetMaps and paste the URI here. The URI has to have this format, for example: https://www.openstreetmap.org/relation/214885 (note the type in the middle: relation, node, way)

Element.name: dateObservation
Element.Documentation: Write the date as it is written in the historical source (transcribe it; e.g., XIIII Kalend. Novembris)

Element.name: dateStart
Element.Documentation: Use this field to enter a date or the beginning of a date range (or the date if there is no date range). Select from the calendar. Adapt if necessary following this pattern: YYYY-MM-DD. If there are uncertainties, use these two uncertainty patterns (here with an example): PATTERN1: 2025-??-17 (use "?" to replace uncertain values, here the day is known to be the 17th, the year is 2025 but the month is unknown). PATTERN2: ~2025-~07 (use "~" to indicate approximate values, here it means that both the year and the month are approximate values). COMBINED example: ~2025-??-17.

Element.name: dateEnd
Element.Documentation: Use this field to enter the end date in a range. Follow the same instructions as for dateStart.

Element.name: noteDate
Element.Documentation: :Add any clarifying notes related to the dates. These notes may be for internal or external use (t.b.d.)

Component.name: Sender
Component.Documentation: Enter first the sender/author as it appears in the letter (transcribe it; e.g. JW); then look for a person reconstruction and select one if it exists.

Element.name: fullName
Element.Documentation: Literal name designates a full personal name. This property may only be left blank if a person's name was unknown or if a person was unnamed (e.g. a child that died shortly after being born), in which cases the property pnv:nameSpecification should state "unknown" or "unnamed". (Note -not in PiCo-: if you are entering the name of a person observation, use this element to enter the name as it appears in the source.

Element.name: givenName
Element.Documentation: A Given name designates the name(s) given to someone at birth or any other name-giving event. In the U.S., the first name of a Person.

Element.name: familyName
Element.Documentation: Family name. In the U.S., the last name of a Person.

Component.name: PlaceDestination
Component.Documentation: Place observation: destination name can be as written in the letter. Place Reconstruction: if known, select to an existing place.
